title: What is the difference between HDR 10, UHD, DOLBY VISION? - Quora

response.answer_text: UHD = Ultra HD is simply a resolution format (4K) HDR10 and Dolby Vision are high-dynamic range formats. HDR 10 is a single layer 10-bit format, while Dolby Vision (as used in Blue Ray) adds another enhancement layer to a 10-bit baseline support 12-bit HDR movies. There is also a single-layer Dolby Vision profile.

UHD = Ultra High Defintion. UHD is a resolution, whereas HDR 10 affects colours. HDR10 makes blacks more black, whites more white etc etc. As for dolby vision, its supposed to provide a more cinematic experience when viewing film and tv
